item.title: List of UFO sightings in the Czech Republic
item.description:
List of UFO Sightings in the Czech Republic ğŸ”—

This article documents alleged UFO sightings in the Czech Republic, spanning from 1976 to 2009.

1976, Radkov ğŸ”—

In 1976, a family in Radkov witnessed a triangular, boomerang-shaped UFO while at a campfire. Two years later, a similar object was reportedly pursued by a military aircraft from Å½atec over Western Bohemia, without success. In 1992, similar objects were observed in Cheb, near Prague, and near DvÅ¯r KrÃ¡lovÃ©.

1987, Vranov ğŸ”—

The Vranov UFO incident, considered the most famous in the Czech Republic, occurred on July 12, 1987, in Vranov nad DyjÃ­ above the Vranov Reservoir. A helicopter regiment was ordered to pursue a black, cigar-shaped object first located near the Austrian border. Pilots were instructed to shoot it down, but the object’s erratic movements and the presence of vacationers below prevented them. First Lieutenant Jaroslav Å paÄek reported the object flew towards their helicopter, forcing them to dodge it. The object then moved at high speed over Brno, JaslovskÃ© Bohunice, and Bratislava before disappearing from radar.

1991, MiliÄÃ­n ğŸ”—

On July 12, 1991, a glowing round object was sighted near MiliÄÃ­n, causing panic among the local population. The sphere appeared randomly and silently followed people. Some witnesses reported seeing figures within the sphere, who allegedly left the sphere to “repair” something on a cottage roof, leaving behind large, four-fingered footprints. A local pastor reportedly told people it was a divine miracle and to remain silent.

1992, TÅ™i Sekery ğŸ”—

On May 5, 1992, military radars detected an object approaching the Czechoslovak border from Germany, crossing near TÅ™i Sekery and heading towards Hvozd. Fighter jets and helicopters were dispatched, but despite radar visibility and ground observers, pilots could not locate the object. The object reportedly headed towards Chomutov and disappeared near Jirkov.

1993, BorovÃ¡ ğŸ”—

On August 21, 1993, a man in BorovÃ¡ encountered a flatfish-shaped object hovering above the road. The object then moved and floated noiselessly. The following day, numerous UFO sightings of various shapes and sizes were reported across the Czech Republic.

2009 ğŸ”—

During late May 2009, multiple reports of flying objects emerged from various locations in the Czech Republic.

  • On May 23, 2009, four people near KlÃ­novec saw four orange lights flying at equal intervals. Similar objects were seen later that night above ChrÃ¡st near PlzeÅˆ.
  • On May 24, 2009, people in Å˜Ã­Äany observed three glowing spheres in the sky.
  • On May 25, 2009, a university professor, who wished to remain anonymous, reported seeing disc-shaped objects resembling car high beams above the Brno highway.

See also ğŸ”—

This section provides a link to the main article “List of reported UFO sightings”.

References ğŸ”—

This section lists the sources cited in the article, including news articles and websites, providing evidence and further information on the reported UFO sightings.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_sightings_in_the_Czech_Republic
